messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] GI Joe
messages.msgSnippet: ... that ... groomed ... LOL!  You could be describing my 2 year old grandson and his sister. Tia

messages.subject: GI Joe
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/11/03 3:32:48 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/11/03 3:32:48 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Anthropologists have postulated that the desire to "groom" (either
Barbie or our primate offspring) is innate in us. (Or at least in women.) >>

Well it's certainly true of Sierra. The boys could care less about doing that
kind of stuff..but she is always trying to fix someones hair.
Jalen (two y.o. brother) just came out with two hair clips on, a pink tutu
and a black velvet girls shirt.
He followed her around and danced with her until that got old, then he
stripped to his diaper and put puddle boots on! Funny guy. He gets groomed
frequently by his sister.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
